request_parameters.name: start_date
request_parameters.description: This is the parameter to indicate the start date of the time length of performance.

request_parameters.name: end_date
request_parameters.description: This is the parameter to indicate the end date of the time length of performance

request_parameters.name: campaign_id_list
request_parameters.description: The campaign ids (comma separated) you want to fetch the performance. (max 100)

response_parameters.name: error
response_parameters.description: Error code, empty when no error returned

response_parameters.name: message
response_parameters.description: error description

response_parameters.name: warning
response_parameters.description: If some data cannot respond normally, set the warning

response_parameters.name: request_id
response_parameters.description: request id is unique for each request

response_parameters.name: response
response_parameters.description: response body

response_parameters.name: shop_id
response_parameters.description: the unique id per shop

response_parameters.name: region
response_parameters.description: the region where each shop is under

response_parameters.name: campaign_list
response_parameters.description: the list of campaign

response_parameters.name: campaign_id
response_parameters.description: the unique id per campaign

response_parameters.name: ad_type
response_parameters.description: auto, manual

response_parameters.name: campaign_placement
response_parameters.description: search, discovery, all

response_parameters.name: ad_name
response_parameters.description: the name of each ad

response_parameters.name: metrics_list
response_parameters.description: the performance metric list

response_parameters.name: date
response_parameters.description: the given date for the performance

response_parameters.name: impression
response_parameters.description: The number of times shoppers see your ad.

response_parameters.name: clicks
response_parameters.description: The number of times shoppers click on your ad. (Note: Shopee filters out repeated clicks from the same shopper that occur within a short time frame.)

response_parameters.name: ctr
response_parameters.description: The click-through rate (CTR) measures how often shoppers end up clicking on your ad after seeing it. It is the number of clicks on your ad divided by the number of times your ad is seen. CTR = clicks ÷ impressions × 100%.

response_parameters.name: expense
response_parameters.description: The amount spent on your ad.

response_parameters.name: broad_gmv
response_parameters.description: The amount of sales revenue generated from shoppers purchasing products within 7 days of them clicking on your ad.

response_parameters.name: broad_order
response_parameters.description: The number of times shoppers purchased any product from your shop within 7 days of them clicking on your ad.

response_parameters.name: broad_order_amount
response_parameters.description: The total quantity of products purchased by shoppers within 7 days of them clicking on your ad.

response_parameters.name: broad_roi
response_parameters.description: Return on ad spend (ROAS) measures how much revenue is generated by your ad relative to the cost of the ad. It is the amount of sales revenue attributed to your ad divided by the amount spent on the ad. ROAS = GMV ÷ expense. (Note: We recommend monitoring ROAS trends on a weekly basis.)

response_parameters.name: broad_cir
response_parameters.description: The advertising cost of sales (ACOS) measures how much your ad costs relative to the revenue the ad generates. It is the amount spent on your ad divided by the amount of sales revenue attributed to the ad. ACOS = expense ÷ GMV × 100%.

response_parameters.name: cr
response_parameters.description: The conversion rate measures how often shoppers end up purchasing something from your shop after clicking on your ad. It is the number of conversions attributed to your ad divided by the number of clicks on the ad. Conversion rate = conversions ÷ clicks × 100%.

response_parameters.name: cpc
response_parameters.description: The cost per conversion is how much each conversion costs, on average. It is the amount spent on your ad divided by the number of conversions attributed to the ad. Cost per conversion = expense ÷ conversions.

response_parameters.name: direct_order
response_parameters.description: The number of times shoppers purchased the advertised product within 7 days of them clicking on the ad.

response_parameters.name: direct_order_amount
response_parameters.description: The total quantity of the advertised product purchased by shoppers within 7 days of them clicking on the ad.

response_parameters.name: direct_gmv
response_parameters.description: The amount of sales revenue generated from shoppers purchasing the advertised product within 7 days of them clicking on the ad.

response_parameters.name: direct_roi
response_parameters.description: The direct return on ad spend, or direct ROAS, measures how much revenue is generated from sales of the advertised product, relative to the cost of the ad. It is the amount of sales revenue for the advertised product attributed to the ad, divided by the amount spent on the ad. Direct ROAS = direct GMV ÷ expense.

response_parameters.name: direct_cir
response_parameters.description: The direct advertising cost of sales, or direct ACOS, measures how much your ad costs relative to the revenue generated from sales of the advertised product. It is the amount spent on the ad divided by the amount of sales revenue for the advertised product that is attributed to the ad. Direct ACOS = expense ÷ direct GMV × 100%.

response_parameters.name: direct_cr
response_parameters.description: The direct conversion rate measures how often shoppers end up purchasing the advertised product after clicking on the ad. Direct conversion rate is the number of direct conversions divided by the number of clicks. Direct conversion rate = direct conversions ÷ clicks × 100%.

response_parameters.name: cpdc
response_parameters.description: The cost per direct conversion is how much each direct conversion costs, on average. It is the amount spent on your ad divided by the number of direct conversions attributed to the ad. Cost per direct conversion = expense ÷ direct conversions.

request_example.python:
import requests
import json

url = "https://partner.test.shopeemobile.com/api/v2/ads/edit_manual_product_ads?access_token=access_token&partner_id=partner_id&shop_id=shop_id&sign=sign&timestamp=timestamp"

payload=json.dumps({
  "budget": 10.5,
  "campaign_id": 112234,
  "discovery_ads_locations": [
    {
      "bid_price": 10.5,
      "location": "daily_discover",
      "status": "active"
    }
  ],
  "edit_action": "start",
  "end_date": "-",
  "enhanced_cpc": True,
  "reference_id": "asdf-1234-qwerty",
  "roas_target": 1.2,
  "smart_creative_setting": "default",
  "start_date": "11-11-2023"
})
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}
response = requests.RPCRequest("POST",url,headers=headers, data=payload, allow_redirects=False)

print(response.text)

v2.ads.get_create_product_ad_budget_sugg.description: Use this API to edit Manual Selection Product Ads

request_parameters.name: reference_id
request_parameters.description: A random string used to prevent duplicate ads. If an ads is created successfully, subsequent request using the same reference id will fail

request_parameters.name: product_selection
request_parameters.description: auto,manual - for Auto product ads or Manual Product Ads

request_parameters.name: campaign_placement
request_parameters.description: search, discovery, all

request_parameters.name: bidding_method
request_parameters.description: Bidding Method of product ad: auto, manual

request_parameters.name: enhanced_cpc
request_parameters.description: Enhanced CPC functionality toggle. Values supported "true"/"false". Mandatory for product_selection=manual, bidding_method=manual

request_parameters.name: discovery_ads_location_names
request_parameters.description: List of comma separated location values from: daily_discover, you_may_also_like. Mandatory for product_selection=manual, product_placement={all|discovery}, bidding_method=manual

request_parameters.name: roas_target
request_parameters.description: the ROAS target for each campaign with auto bidding. If 0, GMV Max / ROI feature is not enabled

request_parameters.name: item_id
request_parameters.description: Product ID. Mandatory for product_selection=manual

response_parameters.name: error
response_parameters.description: Error code, empty when no error returned

response_parameters.name: message
response_parameters.description: error description

response_parameters.name: warning
response_parameters.description: If some data cannot respond normally, set the warning

response_parameters.name: request_id
response_parameters.description: request id is unique for each request

response_parameters.name: response
response_parameters.description: response body

response_parameters.name: budget
response_parameters.description: Budget data

response_parameters.name: recommended_budget
response_parameters.description: Recommended Suggested Budget

response_parameters.name: min_budget
response_parameters.description: Minimun Suggested Budget

response_parameters.name: max_budget
response_parameters.description: Maximum Suggested Budget

v2.ads.get_product_recommended_roi_targe.description: Call this API to get budget suggestion for product ads creation

request_parameters.name: reference_id
request_parameters.description: A random string used to prevent duplicate ads. If an ads is created successfully, subsequent requests using the same reference id will fail - in this case, a new one must be generated. Use the same string for calling suggestion/recommendation API before the actual request to create an ads.

v2.public.get_access_token.description: Use this API to get basic info of merchants which have authorized to the partner.

request_parameters.name: code
request_parameters.description: The code in redirect url after the authorization. Valid for one-time use, expires in 10 minutes

request_parameters.name: partner_id
request_parameters.description: Partner ID is assigned upon registration is successful. Required for all requests.

request_parameters.name: shop_id
request_parameters.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a shop. Required param for most APIs.

request_parameters.name: main_account_id
request_parameters.description: The main_account_id of the seller that authorized the developer

response_parameters.name: refresh_token
response_parameters.description: Returned when the API call is successful.Use refresh_token to get a new access_token. Valid for each shop_id and merchant_id respectively, for 30 days.

response_parameters.name: access_token
response_parameters.description: Returned when the API call is successful.A dynamic token that can be used multiple times and expires after 4 hours.

response_parameters.name: expire_in
response_parameters.description: Returned when the API call is successful.The validity period of the access_token, in seconds.

response_parameters.name: request_id
response_parameters.description: ID of API requests; always returned. Used to diagnose problems.

response_parameters.name: error
response_parameters.description: Error codes for API requests; always returned.When the API call is successful, the error code returned is empty.

response_parameters.name: message
response_parameters.description: Always returned. Provides detailed error information.

response_parameters.name: merchant_id_list
response_parameters.description: Returned when there is main_account_id in the input parameter, including all the merchant_ids authorized this time under the main account.

response_parameters.name: shop_id_list
response_parameters.description: Returned when there is main_account_id in the input parameter, including all shop_ids authorized this time under the main account.

response_parameters.name: supplier_id_list
response_parameters.description: Returned when authorized to supplier account, including all supplier_id authorized this time under the account.

error_codes.error_description: There is no partner_id in query.
There is no sign in query.
The code is expired or used or invalid, please check the code.
The code or main_accoount_id is wrong, please check the code or the main_account_id.
Invalid partner_id, please have a check.
The code or shop_id is wrong, please check the code or the shop_id.

v2.public.refresh_access_token.description: Use the code and shop_id or main_account_id from the authorization step to call this API to obtain the shop_id, merchant_id, access_token and refresh_token.

request_parameters.name: refresh_token
request_parameters.description: Use refresh_token to get a new access_token. Each refresh_token is valid for 30 days, and can only be used once by either a shop_id or merchant_id.

request_parameters.name: partner_id
request_parameters.description: The partner_id obtained from the App. This partner_id is inserted into the body.

request_parameters.name: shop_id
request_parameters.description: The shop_id of the main account that granted authorization to your App. Only the shop_id or merchant_id can be selected as the input parameter, and they must be refreshed separately.

request_parameters.name: merchant_id
request_parameters.description: The merchant_id for identifying the main account that granted authorization to your App. Only the shop_id or merchant_id can be selected as the input parameter, and they must be refreshed separately.

response_parameters.name: partner_id
response_parameters.description: Returned when the API call is successful.The partner_id you used for this refresh

response_parameters.name: refresh_token
response_parameters.description: New refresh_tokenReturned when the API call is successful.Use a refresh_token to get a new access_token.Each refresh_token is valid for 30 days, and can only be used once by either a shop_id or merchant_id.

response_parameters.name: access_token
response_parameters.description: Returned when the API call is successful.Each new access_token is a dynamic token that can be used multiple times. It expires after 4 hours.

response_parameters.name: expire_in
response_parameters.description: Returned when the API call is successful.The validity period of the access_token, in seconds.

response_parameters.name: request_id
response_parameters.description: ID of API requests; always returned.Used to diagnose problems.

response_parameters.name: error
response_parameters.description: Error codes for API requests; always returned.When the API call is successful, the error code returned is empty.

response_parameters.name: message
response_parameters.description: Always returned. Provides detailed error information.

response_parameters.name: shop_id
response_parameters.description: Returned when the API call is successful.The shop_id for this refresh

response_parameters.name: merchant_id
response_parameters.description: Returned when the API call is successful.The merchant_id for this refresh, for identifying each merchant.

v2.push.set_app_push_config.description: You can get shopee ip address ranges through this open api.

request_parameters.name: callback_url
request_parameters.description: The callback url of push mechanism. It is the address where the Shopee will send the push message to. If you don't set any callback_url before, this parameters is required.

request_parameters.name: set_push_config_on
request_parameters.description: Turn on push config, Shopee will send the push message into the callback url. 1=Shop authorization for partners 2=Shop deauthorization for partners 3=Order status update push 4=TrackingNo push 5=Shopee Updates 6=Banned item push 7=item promotion push 8=reserved stock change push 9=promotionn update push 10=webchat push 11=video upload push 12=openapi authorization expiry push 13=brand register result

request_parameters.name: set_push_config_off
request_parameters.description: Turn off Push config, Shopee won't send the push message into the callback url. 1=Shop authorization for partners 2=Shop deauthorization for partners 3=Order status update push 4=TrackingNo push 5=Shopee Updates 6=Banned item push 7=item promotion push 8=reserved stock change push 9=promotionn update push 10=webchat push 11=video upload push 12=openapi authorization expiry push 13=brand register result

request_parameters.name: blocked_shop_id_list
request_parameters.description: Use this filed to set shops that need to be blocked.Please input no more than 500 shop id.

response_parameters.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking.

response_parameters.description: Indicate error details if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

response_parameters.description: Detail informations you are querying.

response_parameters.name: result
response_parameters.description: Use this field to indicate whether the configuration is set successfully.

payload=json.dumps({

    10010,
    20020,
    30030
  ],
  "callback_url": "https://open.shopee.com/",
  "set_push_config_off": [
    6,
    7,
    11,
    12,
    13
  ],
  "set_push_config_on": [
    1,
    2,
    3,
    4,
    5,
    8,
    9,
    10
  ]
})
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}
response = requests.request("POST",url,headers=headers, data=payload, allow_redirects=False)

print(response.text)

v2.push.get_app_push_config.description: you can turn on or turn off your app push config setting through this open api

response_parameters.name: request_id
response_parameters.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking.

response_parameters.name: error
response_parameters.description: Indicate error type if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

response_parameters.name: message
response_parameters.description: Indicate error details if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

response_parameters.name: response
response_parameters.description: Detail informations you are querying.

response_parameters.name: callback_url
response_parameters.description: The callback url of push mechanism. It is the address where the Shopee will send the push message to. If you don't set any callback_url before, this parameters is required.

response_parameters.name: live_push_status
response_parameters.description: live push status:Normal,Warning,Suspended

response_parameters.name: suspended_time
response_parameters.description: The live push suspended time caused by low successful rate of push mechanism.Only when live push status is suspended, this parameters will response.

response_parameters.name: blocked_shop_id
response_parameters.description: Use this filed to indicate that Shopee won't send any push message created by this shop.

response_parameters.name: push_config_on_list
response_parameters.description: Use this field to indicate which push config turn on, and you can receive the push message. 1=Shop authorization for partners 2=Shop deauthorization for partners 3=Order status update push 4=TrackingNo push 5=Shopee Updates 6=Banned item push 7=item promotion push 8=reserved stock change push 9=promotionn update push 10=webchat push 11=video upload push 12=openapi authorization expiry push 13=brand register result

response_parameters.name: push_config_off_list
response_parameters.description: Use this field to indicate which push config turn on, and you can receive the push message. 1=Shop authorization for partners 2=Shop deauthorization for partners 3=Order status update push 4=TrackingNo push 5=Shopee Updates 6=Banned item push 7=item promotion push 8=reserved stock change push 9=promotionn update push 10=webchat push 11=video upload push 12=openapi authorization expiry push 13=brand register result
